TextureFX is essentially vvvvs answer to [http://freeframe.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/freeframe/trunk/docs/specification.html|freeframeGL], i.e. a specification for modules that do GPU-based texture-generation, -manipulation and -analyis. The idea was triggered by ((user:karistouf)) in his thread with the almost poetic title ((forum:pure-image-treatment-question-wich-evolution-for-vvvv)) and implementation is expertly lead by ((user:unc)). The whole series of modules/effects is now part of the ((about the addonpack|Addonpack)).

!TextureFX Specification 1.0
The modules are organized in the following categories using the mentioned in- and outputs:

!!EX9.Texture
Misc modules like "Resize" and "Preview" that are very general to the EX9.Texture category.

!!EX9.Texture Source
Modules returning a texture generated by the given input parameters.
* Any number of optional input parameters
* One texture output named ((pin:Output))

!!EX9.Texture Filter
Modules transforming the input texture by the given input parameters.
* One texture input named ((pin:Input))
* An optional texture input named ((pin:Control)) for a per-pixel parameter
* Any number of optional input parameters
* One texture output named ((pin:Output))

!!EX9.Texture Mixer
Modules mixing/blending together/fading between multiple input textures.
* Multiple texture inputs named ((pin:Input 1)), ((pin:Input 2)),...
* A texture input named ((pin:Control)) for a per-pixel parameter
* An input parameter called ((pin:Blend)) that controls the fading between multiple textures. 
* One texture output named ((pin:Output))

!!EX9.Texture Join
Modules taking different texture channels and combining them to one output texture.
* Multiple texture inputs named e.g. like ((pin:Red)), ((pin:Green)),...
* One texture output named ((pin:Output))

!!EX9.Texture Split
Modules splitting textures up into individual channels.
* One texture input named ((pin:Input))
* Multiple texture outputs named e.g. like ((pin:Red)), ((pin:Green)),...

!!EX9.Texture Analysis
Modules returning analysis data from a given input texture, like trackers,...
* One texture input named ((pin:Input))
* Any number of optional input parameters
* At least one output parameter
